reviews.text: The USP of Ginger New Delhi is its excellent location. Just outside New Delhi railway station (though not directly approachable - the road leading to it is indirect) and a stone's throw from the Metro station.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value for money..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms give good value for money. For about 1800 bucks, you get all the basic amenities, and for a place in the center of the city, that is good value for money. Rooms, though on the smaller side, were generally neat and tidy. They have the Comesum restaurent on the ground floor which offers decent meals. There is no room service though.
reviews.title: An Excellent Experience

reviews.text: All-in-all, if you are looking for a not too expensive place to stay in while also wanting to do your sightseeing or visiting people on business, Ginger New Delhi might be it for you.
reviews.title: Excellent budget Hotel in Delhi

reviews.text: I visited this hotel last month and found this one is one of the excellent budget hotels of NCR. But most of the time you can't get the rooms on arrival. You should book this hotel rooms prior estimately 10 days prior. The reception guys were well mannered and we found that they were very supportive. Lift, water purifier, AC, mini fridge were in good condition. Although the room and bathroom was small but that was well-equipped. CC-Cams were installed everywhere in the hotel(Not in your room) for security reasons. Only air-to-air free channels were present in TV. Housekeeping service was also good. It has a self-serviced restaurant with hygienic food items. Overall this is a good choice for you.
reviews.title: Loosing the charm it had

reviews.text: I recently stayed in Ginger IRCTC New Delhi.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night. The rooms are decorated in a basic urban style with clean beds and washrooms (there is a separate shower area in the family room). You can expect in-room facilities like ac, lcd, coffee, minibar, safe, desk, cupboard etc. The food was pretty decent at the cafeteria (we tried only Indian cuisine). The overall service was also good.
reviews.title: Great value for money for a short stay

reviews.text: Try to book the family room. It costs about INR 200 more than the superior room, but has 4 single beds, 2 air-cons, separate toilet and shower areas and is quite bigger in size.
reviews.title: Only for sleeping

reviews.text: The family room cannot be booked online however. You need to book it through their call centers. The booking window opens exactly 30 days before the date of check-in.
reviews.title: Leisure

reviews.text: I feel this hotel has the best facilities compared to other budget accommodations in its price range. However, if you are looking for a little luxury or to indulge yourself, this is not the place to stay. It is a very good, no-fuss option for a quick stopover.
reviews.title: A big disappointment even before checking in!
Nothing to "Ginger Up"
reviews.text: The most modest hotel I've stayed in for a long time. Comfortable clean beds, very basic room, noisy air conditioning. But has fridge, water, TV, shower, kettle, coffee. Very basic food in the restaurant. When I arrived they could not give me a key, so I was let in the room by bell boy. Safe. Ok for sleeping, bring earplugs.
This hotel is only ideal for those who need to be close to New Delhi Railway Station as it is accessible at any hour of the day or night.
reviews.title: Stay only if you have to.

reviews.text: This is an absolutely basic hotel. Clean linen (bed-sheets) but old faded towels. Toilets are very basic. Most of the bathroom drains clogged so when you shower, your feet are 2 inches deep in water.
reviews.title: PLEASENT AND HASSEL FREE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Idea of staying at thos hotel should be only functional and for no other reason one should stay here except for those who are used to staying in dharamshalas or guest-houses. Ginger is only a branded dharamshala. Food in Comesome restaurant is fairly decent though but nothing is included in room tariff.
reviews.title: Small Rooms but value for Money

reviews.text: When you walk in there is no complications, online booking-check in at reception-enjoy ur stay !!! 24x7 food available with room service-ATM-PHARMACY !!! BEST Value for money, as you hear the word GINGER you can expect quite a good experience.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rooms are small but very good with all facilities. It is basically self service and has a restaurant at the ground floor where food is available at nominal rates. The location is very ideal, very near to New Delhi Railway Station and the metro station.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: I used Ginger Hotel twice in July, 2012. The main advantage is it is close to the New Delhi Railway Station. The Hotel interiors are good, neat and clean.
reviews.title: Close to New Delhi Rly Station, but small rooms

reviews.text: Even though I booked a Double room, it looked like a single room. You can make out the different with the 2 beds there. Air Condition is very old. It's a kind of retiring room, rather than a Hotel room.
reviews.title: Decent stay close to Railway station

reviews.text: While returning, 2nd time when I used this hotel, I had a horrible experience. Some bad smells were keep coming from the nearest public toilet. I felt like vomitting. I complained to the reception, they sent someone to spray some kind of room spray, but didn't solve the problem. As we were staying only for a short while we didn't ask for a different room.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for travellers!

reviews.text: Otherwise it is a value for money hotel. Suitable mainly for those who travel by New Delhi Railway Station.
reviews.title: Delivers Satisfaction

reviews.text: This Hotel is good if u arrive late at New Delhi railway station and have an early morning flight or Train to catch. First advise is that this Hotel is just opposite to Railway station and is at walking distance though a bit confusing. I took an Auto as i had 4 luggage and wife with and they fleeced me by charging 150 Rs, this is not worth as it is hardly 200 m from the Ajmeri gate. My Check in was a cake walk and was in the room in 5 minutes. The rooms are pretty small and locks are worn out, i was afraid that somebody may break in but did not worry to call front desk as i had to wake up early morning at 3:30 am and it was already 11:30 pm. I didn't have a chance to check out their restaurant. The Hotel is in a pretty safe place and close to railway station as well as Metro and Metro airport express. One thing some people may find annoying is the train siren and the constant blaring of horns even in the middle of night. The linen was not clean and my wife was complaining about bed bugs
reviews.title: Rail yatri Nivas
